title: Scotland `shafted´ by UK Government in Brexit deal -...
text:
The UK Government is “shafting” Scotland after agreeing a Brexit deal with the European Union, according to the SNP’s Ian Blackford.

Speaking on the BBC’s Victoria Live programme, the party’s Westminster leader said the deal announced on Thursday by Boris Johnson would give Northern Ireland a competitive advantage over Scotland.

The MP said although he welcomes an agreement which would effectively allow Northern Ireland to stay in the customs union and the single market, he added that calls for Scotland to have a similar arrangement had been ignored.

Westminster will sit on Saturday to vote on the deal, with the SNP having confirmed its 35 MPs will not support it.

Mr Blackford said: “If it does go through (the deal), we will be saying to the opposition parties that we have to come together.

“We have to remove Boris Johnson’s Government from office and we have to move to an early general election.

SNP Westminster leader Ian Blackford has criticised the new Brexit deal Boris Johnson has agreed with the EU (PA)

“This is a deal that if it does get support in the House of Commons, is going to be devastating for our communities, devastating for jobs.

“There’s an important point here, and obviously we appreciate the unique circumstances of Northern Ireland, everyone wants to see the continuation of peace and security.

“But Northern Ireland in effect is being kept in the single market and the customs union.

“That was our compromise position and the UK Government has completely ignored us.

“The UK Government is shafting Scotland and we need to make sure that we can get to that election.”

Asked whether he believes Northern Ireland has been given a “privileged” position, Mr Blackford said: “Absolutely. This is a competitive advantage that Northern Ireland is going to have.

“That’s important for business but also for fishing and farming. So if you think about all those who are engaged in fishing off the west coast, those that are engaged in farming, they’re not going to get the same terms and opportunities that are going to be offered to those in Northern Ireland.

“I welcome the fact that Northern Ireland has got this deal but Scotland has been ignored through this.

“In a country that has voted so heavily to remain, I’d simply say to the people of Scotland that we need to have a general election and people have to respond to the position that we’ve got that if people vote for the SNP, then that’s a vote for the people of Scotland to have their right to determine their future in an independence referendum.

“We want to stay in Europe, we want to be an independent country, we want to be a destination in Europe and, if you like, that bridge between Europe and a United Kingdom that might be outside of it.

“But we sit back and allow the UK to take us out of the European Union against our will.”

There have also been calls for a motion of no confidence to be triggered against the UK Government.

However, Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn has backed having another EU vote before an election is held.

Mr Blackford said: “We are happy to trigger a motion of no confidence, we’ve said to the other opposition parties, ‘accept your responsibilities’.

“I look forward to having an election and pitting ourselves against the Tory MPs in Scotland that look as if they’re going to vote for this.

“They’re going to vote against the interests of the people of Scotland, and the other opposition parties should accept their responsibilities as well.”
description: The SNP´s Westminster leader said the arrangements will put Northern Ireland at an advantage over Scotland.
